thread.title: Ghana FA Boss Kwesi Nyantakyi welcomes FIFA Boss Issa Hayyatou on behalf of CAF
thread.title_full: Ghana FA Boss Kwesi Nyantakyi welcomes FIFA Boss Issa Hayyatou on behalf of CAF

title: Ghana FA Boss Kwesi Nyantakyi welcomes FIFA Boss Issa Hayyatou on behalf of CAF
text:
18:10 CET Ghana FA Boss Kwesi Nyantakyi welcomes FIFA Boss Issa Hayyatou on behalf of CAF - www.ghanasoccernet.com 
The President of the Ghana Football Association, Kwesi Nyantakyi, today at the headquarters of the Confederations of African Football (CAF) welcomed acting FIFA President Issah Hayyatou on behalf of CAF at their maiden meeting since Hayyatou assumed the position of president of the world football governing body, FIFA . 
It was Hayyatou's first appearance since the implementation of the statutory provisions of FIFA that made him the interim president of the world football governing body since October 8, 2015. 
Members of the standing committees of CAF, now in Cairo for the annual meetings, were also present as Issa Hayatou was greeted by a round of applause as upon entering the lobby. 
Playful, the FIFA President was keen to shake hands with all those present, some even boasting braces. 
The Ghana FA boss Kwesi Nyantakyi, who is also member of the Executive Committee of CAF welcomed Mr. Hayyatou and lauded his appointement for making the continent proud. 
“The position now occupied by Issa Hayatou FIFA honors all of Africa. We are all proud as we are Africans, although we now know that his mission is to lead world football without discrimination,' Nyantakyi said 
'We have always given our support in fulfilling your mission to CAF and we need to do a little more today because your success to FIFA will be ours too and the whole continent. Here the opportunity to furnish proof of the quality of its leadership in Africa, and allow FIFA to complete its transformation and reform process,” Kwesi added. 
Issa Hayyatou will be FIFA President for the 75 days after assuming the presidential position following the suspension of Sepp Blatter by the Ethics Committee of the world football governing body for 90 days. 
For more Ghana football news visit www.ghanasoccernet.com
